mechanics.condition: Area for Hallow spell includes an area already under the effect of another Hallow spell

mechanics.trigger: Creature attempts to enter Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Creature is a Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead (unless specifically excluded by the caster)

mechanics.trigger: Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead creature attempts to charm, frighten, or possess a creature within Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Acting creature is a Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead (unless specifically excluded by the caster)
mechanics.outcome: Attempt fails; acting creature cannot charm, frighten, or possess creatures within the Hallow area

mechanics.condition: Creature is currently Charmed, Frightened, or Possessed by a Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead
mechanics.outcome: The Charmed, Frightened, or Possessed condition on the creature ends immediately

mechanics.trigger: Creature (designated by caster) enters Hallow area for the first time on a turn OR starts its turn within Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Hallow has an extra effect chosen that applies to this creature
mechanics.outcome: Creature can make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature ignores the extra effect until it leaves the area.

mechanics.trigger: Creature (designated by caster) within Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Hallow has 'Courage' chosen as an extra effect AND creature is affected by Hallow's extra effect
Hallow has 'Darkness' chosen as an extra effect
mechanics.outcome: Darkness fills the area. Normal light and magical light created by spells of a lower level than Hallow cannot illuminate the area.

mechanics.condition: Hallow has 'Daylight' chosen as an extra effect
mechanics.outcome: Bright light fills the area. Magical darkness created by spells of a lower level than Hallow cannot extinguish the light.

mechanics.trigger: Creature (designated by caster) takes damage within Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Hallow has 'Energy Protection' chosen for a specific damage type (except bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing) AND creature is affected by Hallow's extra effect AND creature takes that chosen damage type
mechanics.outcome: Creature has resistance to the chosen damage type

mechanics.trigger: Creature (designated by caster) takes damage within Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Hallow has 'Energy Vulnerability' chosen for a specific damage type (except bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing) AND creature is affected by Hallow's extra effect AND creature takes that chosen damage type
mechanics.outcome: Creature has vulnerability to the chosen damage type

mechanics.trigger: Attempt to turn dead body into undead within Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Hallow has 'Everlasting Rest' chosen as an extra effect AND dead body is interred in the Hallow area
mechanics.outcome: Dead body cannot be turned into undead

mechanics.trigger: Creature (designated by caster) attempts to move or travel using teleportation or extradimensional/interplanar means within Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Hallow has 'Extradimensional Interference' chosen as an extra effect AND creature is affected by Hallow's extra effect
mechanics.outcome: Creature cannot use teleportation or extradimensional/interplanar travel

mechanics.trigger: Creature (designated by caster) within Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Hallow has 'Fear' chosen as an extra effect AND creature is affected by Hallow's extra effect

mechanics.trigger: Sound attempts to emanate from within or reach into Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Hallow has 'Silence' chosen as an extra effect
mechanics.outcome: No sound can emanate from within the area, and no sound can reach into it

mechanics.trigger: Creature (designated by caster) attempts to communicate with another creature within Hallow area
mechanics.condition: Hallow has 'Tongues' chosen as an extra effect AND creature is affected by Hallow's extra effect
mechanics.outcome: Creature can communicate with any other creature in the area, even if they don't share a common language

description_text: You touch a point and infuse an area around it with holy (or unholy) power. The area can have a radius up to 60 feet, and the spell fails if the radius includes an area already under the effect a hallow spell. The affected area is subject to the following effects. First, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead can't enter the area, nor can such creatures charm, frighten, or possess creatures within it. Any creature charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature is no longer charmed, frightened, or possessed upon entering the area. You can exclude one or more of those types of creatures from this effect. Second, you can bind an extra effect to the area. Choose the effect from the following list, or choose an effect offered by the GM. Some of these effects apply to creatures in the area; you can designate whether the effect applies to all creatures, creatures that follow a specific deity or leader, or creatures of a specific sort, such as ores or trolls. When a creature that would be affected enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it can make a charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature ignores the extra effect until it leaves the area. Courage. Affected creatures can't be frightened while in the area. Darkness. Darkness fills the area. Normal light, as well as magical light created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell, can't illuminate the area. Daylight. Bright light fills the area. Magical darkness created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell can't extinguish the light. Energy Protection. Affected creatures in the area have resistance to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing. Energy Vulnerability. Affected creatures in the area have vulnerability to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing. Everlasting Rest. Dead bodies interred in the area can't be turned into undead. Extradimensional Interference. Affected creatures can't move or travel using teleportation or by extradimensional or interplanar means. Fear. Affected creatures are frightened while in the area. Silence. No sound can emanate from within the area, and no sound can reach into it. Tongues. Affected creatures can communicate with any other creature in the area, even if they don't share a common language.
